info.author: Orlof
classifiers: License :: OSI Approved :: GNU Library or Lesser General Public License (LGPL)
info.description:
Nadds is a library of Python extensions that complement the standard
libraries in parts where full support for the UNIX API (or the Linux
API) is missing.

Most of the functions wrapped by Nadds are low-level, dirty, but
absolutely necessary functions for real systems programming. These 
functions are mostly added to mainstream Python3.

Current list of features included:

- recvmsg(2) and sendmsg(2), including use of cmsg(3)

- socketpair(2)

- support for TUN/TAP virtual network interfaces
info.name: nadds
info.summary: Low level linux api calls for python
info.html_description:
Nadds is a library of Python extensions that complement the standard libraries in parts where full support for the UNIX API (or the Linux API) is missing.

Most of the functions wrapped by Nadds are low-level, dirty, but absolutely necessary functions for real systems programming. These functions are mostly added to mainstream Python3.

Current list of features included:

  • recvmsg(2) and sendmsg(2), including use of cmsg(3)
  • socketpair(2)
  • support for TUN/TAP virtual network interfaces
